# Christian Democratic Party (Democratic Republic of the Congo)

| president = Castro Bamboka lobendi
| foundation = 2006
| secretary_general = Désiré Kashemwa
| headquarters = Kinshasa
| spokesperson = Blaise Mastaky Birindwa
| ideology = Christian democracyFederalism
| seats2_title = Seats in the Senate
| seats2 = }}
| country = the Democratic Republic of the Congo
}}
The Christian Democratic Party () is a political party in the Democratic Republic of Congo. The party won eight out of 500 seats in the 2006 parliamentary elections. In the 19 January 2007 Senate elections, the party won six out of 108 seats.
